panels.description: Current peer connections this edge holds against remote edges.

targets.expr: xcp_edge_stream_connect_count_total{statusLabel="ok", cluster_name="$cluster"} - ignoring(statusLabel) xcp_edge_stream_connect_count_total{statusLabel="close", cluster_name="$cluster"} OR on() xcp_edge_stream_connect_count_total{statusLabel="ok", cluster_name="$cluster"}

panels.title: Active connections to central

panels.description:
Time since any of the following messages is sent by edge to central:
1. Periodic(per minute) config resync request
2. Ack of last config received 
3. Cluster state
Because regular periodic resync requests would be going out periodically, a high value than the resync period, 60 sec default,  is not normal.
panels.title: Time since any message sent to central on config stream (seconds)

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to build the local cluster state. This build time is subset of cluster-update-propagation time
panels.title: cluster-state build time percentiles(in secs)
Number of times cluster states sent to central

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: cluster-state propagation delay percentiles(in secs)

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 0-1.5 secs

panels.description:
Number of times config statuses are sent by edge to central, with respective objects' Kind.

Messages received by central from any edge are of three types:
1. Periodic(per minute by default) config resync request
2. cluster state
3. Header message to ack the config received

This number is combined count of all three in the last 5 min.
panels.title: Number of times config status sent by edge to central in last 5 min

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 1.5-2.5 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 2.5-4 secs

panels.description: Length of the cluster state events queue at the current moment. This metric is useful to track the cluster state events currently in the queue and ready to be dequeued and sent to central. A high value of this metric means that events are getting enqueued but dequeuing is blocked because of some bottleneck at sending to the central part.
panels.title: Length of cluster state event queue

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 4-7 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 11-15 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 7-11 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 15-20 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 20-30 secs

panels.description: Time (in secs) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in 30-40 secs

panels.description: Time (in ms) taken to propagate a change in the local cluster state to remote central
panels.title: propagated to central  in more than 40 secs

panels.description: Number of times cluster states are received by edge from central in the last 1 min.
panels.title: Number of times cluster states received by edge from central in last 1 min

panels.description: Total time taken in completing Istio translation for all the app namespaces
panels.title: config translation duration percentiles(in ms)

panels.description: Number of times cluster states are received by edge from central
panels.title: Number of times config CRs received by edge from central in last 5 min

panels.description: Number of Istio config translations in Edge per namespace per min
panels.title: Translation count per min

panels.description: Shows the activity of Edge creating objects in K8s API, grouped by object kind.
panels.title: Number of configs created/updated by edge at k8s apiserver  every 5 minutes

panels.description: Shows the activity of Edge deleting objects in K8s API, grouped by object kind.
panels.title: Number of configs deleted by edge from k8s apiserver  every 5 minutes
k8s config apply duration P50 percentiles for each namespace (in ms)
k8s config apply duration P90 percentiles for each namespace (in ms)
k8s config apply duration P99 percentiles for each namespace (in ms)

panels.description: This shows the number of active goroutines in XCP Edge that are responsible for config translation.
panels.title: Edge specific gorountines

panels.description: This panel represents the increase in custom resource events received by the edge registry controller in the last 5 minutes.
panels.title: Custom Resource events[5m]

panels.description: This Panel represents the increase in EDS update events received by the Edge registry controller in the last 5 minutes.
panels.title: EDS Update events[5m]

panels.description: This panel represents the increase in namespace events received by the Edge in the last 5-minute interval. Edge responds to the namespace events through its namespace controller.
panels.title: Namespace Events[5m]

panels.description:
This panel represents the increase in node events received by the Edge Kubernetes registry controller in the last 5 minutes.

There are two different sources for node events. Edge responds differently for different node event sources:
- Node Controller: Used for Gateway Hold webhook
- XDS Updater Config Update: Used to update node port service addresses
panels.title: Node Events received[5m]

panels.description: This panel represents the Svc Update events received by the edge Kubernetes registry controller in 5-minute intervals.
panels.title: SvcUpdate events[5m]

panels.description: This Panel represents the increase in Service entry events received by the Edge Kubernetes registry controller in the last 5 minutes.
panels.title: Service Entry events received[5m]
